column4: it said it was gksudo, so I killed that and the install is still there
how do I do a net install of desktop?
why when I killed the process did it not go away?
what did you try to kill?
you should be fine with the alternate install
it might be possible, if not you can use xubuntu
xubuntu is gtk based, everything that you run in gnome should be able to work with xubuntu
it basically is a more lightweight de, and comes with a more lightweight suite of apps
no, just the way it operates and the apps it includes
you can still install any gnome apps you may miss
just log out, choose one of them in sessions, and log in
don't worry about it, those sorts of things require you to learn about mounting manually and idesk... just stick with xubuntu or ubuntu for now
